# Example PyQt code
from PyQt5.QtWidgets import QApplication, QLabel
app = QApplication([])
label = QLabel('Hello, PyQt!')
label.show()
app.exec_()

# Example PySide2 code
from PySide2.QtWidgets import QApplication, QLabel
app = QApplication([])
label = QLabel('Hello, PySide2!')
label.show()
app.exec_()

# Example PyQt code
from PyQt5.QtWidgets import QApplication, QPushButton
app = QApplication([])
button = QPushButton('Click me, PyQt!')
button.show()
app.exec_()

# Example PySide2 code
from PySide2.QtWidgets import QApplication, QPushButton
app = QApplication([])
button = QPushButton('Click me, PySide2!')
button.show()
app.exec_()

app = QApplication([])
button = QPushButton('Press me, PyQt!')
button.show()
app.exec_()

# Example PySide2 code
from PySide2.QtWidgets import QApplication, QPushButton
app = QApplication([])
button = QPushButton('Press me, PySide2!')
button.show()
app.exec_()

app = QApplication([])
radio_button = QRadioButton('Select me, PyQt!')
radio_button.show()
app.exec_()

# Example PyQt code
from PyQt5.QtWidgets import QApplication, QInputDialog
app = QApplication([])
input_text, ok_pressed = QInputDialog.getText(None, 'Input Dialog', 'Enter your text:')
if ok_pressed:
    print(f'You entered: {input_text}')

# Example PySide2 code
from PySide2.QtWidgets import QApplication, QInputDialog
app = QApplication([])
input_text, ok_pressed = QInputDialog.getText(None, 'Input Dialog', 'Enter your text:')
if ok_pressed:
    print(f'You entered: {input_text}')

# Example PyQt code
from PyQt5.QtWidgets import QApplication, QColorDialog
app = QApplication([])
color = QColorDialog.getColor()
if color.isValid():
    print(f'Selected color: {color.name()}')

# Example PySide2 code
from PySide2.QtWidgets import QApplication, QColorDialog
app = QApplication([])
color = QColorDialog.getColor()
if color.isValid():
    print(f'Selected color: {color.name()}')

# Example PyQt code
from PyQt5.QtWidgets import QApplication, QScrollBar, QVBoxLayout, QWidget
app= QApplication([])

# Create a widget
widget = QWidget()

# Create a vertical layout
layout = QVBoxLayout(widget)

# Create a scroll bar
scroll_bar = QScrollBar()

# Add the scroll bar to the layout
layout.addWidget(scroll_bar)

# Show the widget
widget.show()

# Start the application
app.exec_()

# Example PySide2 code
from PySide2.QtWidgets import QApplication, QScrollBar, QVBoxLayout, QWidget
app = QApplication([])

# Create a widget
widget = QWidget()

# Create a vertical layout
layout = QVBoxLayout(widget)

# Create a scroll bar
scroll_bar = QScrollBar()

# Add the scroll bar to the layout
layout.addWidget(scroll_bar)

# Show the widget
widget.show()

# Start the application
app.exec_()

# Example PyQt code
from PyQt5.QtWidgets import QApplication, QMainWindow, QMenuBar, QMenu
app = QApplication([])

# Create a main window
main_window = QMainWindow()

# Create a menu bar
menu_bar = main_window.menuBar()

# Create a menu
file_menu = menu_bar.addMenu('File')

# Show the main window
main_window.show()

# Start the application
app.exec_()
